articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: Donald Trump’s hush money criminal trial is set to resume in New York on Tuesday with testimony from a banker familiar with accounts involved in the former U.S. president's alleged scheme to influence the 2016 election by covering up a sex scandal.
articles.title: Trump NYC hush money trial to resume with banker's testimony

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Pro-Palestinian protesters at Columbia University were occupying a building on the New York City campus on Tuesday as officials limited access to students who live there and essential employees.
articles.title: Pro-Palestinian protesters occupy building at Columbia University - CNN

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday that he will discuss with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu measures that Israel still needs to take to increase the flow of aid into Gaza, as he holds meetings in the country on Wednesday.
articles.title: Blinken says he will press Netanyahu on Gaza aid measures

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Tuesday that its air defence systems had shot down six U.S.-produced Army Tactical Missile Systems (ATACMS) launched by Ukraine over the last 24 hours.
articles.title: Russia shoots down six U.S.-made ATACMS missiles

articles.author: Andrew Macaskill
articles.description: Eli Harel was an Israeli soldier in his early thirties when he was sent into Lebanon in 2006 to battle fighters from the Iranian-backed group Hezbollah in a bloody, largely inconclusive month-long war.
articles.title: Residents of northern Israel brace for possible all-out war with Hezbollah

articles.author: Iryna Nazarchuk
articles.description: A Russian missile attack on an educational institution in a popular seafront park in the Ukrainian Black Sea port of Odesa on Monday killed at least five people and injured 32, local officials said.
articles.title: Russian missile hits educational institution, kills five in Ukraine's Odesa

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A smiling and healthy-looking King Charles returned to public duties on Tuesday for the first time since he was diagnosed in February with cancer, paying a visit to a treatment centre for the disease in London.
articles.title: Smiling King Charles visits cancer centre on his return to public duties

articles.author: Tim Reid
articles.description: Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump does not rule out building detention camps on U.S. soil for migrants in the country illegally if he wins a second White House term, he told Time magazine in an interview published on Tuesday.
articles.title: Trump does not rule out building detention camps for mass deportations

articles.author: Andrew Gray
articles.description: Ukraine's trust in its NATO allies has "taken a dent" because of delays and failures in the delivery of arms for the war against Russia’s invasion, NATO boss Jens Stoltenberg said.
articles.title: Ukraine’s trust in NATO allies dented by arms delivery failures, Stoltenberg says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Haiti's transition council on Tuesday named Edgard Leblanc, the former senate president, to head the body instated last week as it seeks to bring security back to the violence-wracked Caribbean nation.
articles.title: Haiti transition council names former senate leader as president
